--- title: "Tidyverse" subtitle: "Data Science at TUHH" author: "Nadine Hartlef" --- ## SALES ANALYSIS First Part ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_a0a9421a4aa808cb408fbc096a69236f'} ```{.r .cell-code} # 1.0 Load libraries ---- library(readr) library(readxl) library(tidyverse) library(stats) library(writexl) library(lubridate) library(lobstr) ``` ::: ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_ac57a2d078052d82d2f615f711ef0f25'} ```{.r .cell-code} # 2.0 Importing Files ---- orderlines_tbl <- read_excel("C:\\Users\\nadin\\Documents\\GitHub\\ss23-bdsb-Nadinini\\01_bike_sales\\01_raw_data\\orderlines.xlsx") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> New names: #> • `` -> `...1` ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} bikes_tbl <- read_excel("C:\\Users\\nadin\\Documents\\GitHub\\ss23-bdsb-Nadinini\\01_bike_sales\\01_raw_data\\bikes.xlsx") bikeshops_tbl <- read_excel("C:\\Users\\nadin\\Documents\\GitHub\\ss23-bdsb-Nadinini\\01_bike_sales\\01_raw_data\\bikeshops.xlsx") # 3.0 Examining Data ---- #glimpse() # 4.0 Joining Data ---- bike_joined_tbl <- orderlines_tbl %>% left_join(bikes_tbl, by = c("product.id" = "bike.id")) %>% left_join(bikeshops_tbl, by = c("customer.id" = "bikeshop.id")) # 5.0 Wrangling Data and Writing File ---- ## Challenge Sales by location bike_orderlines_wrangled_tbl <- bike_joined_tbl %>% separate(col = category, into = c("category.1","category.2","category.3"), sep = " - ") %>% separate(col = location, into = c("city", "state"), sep = ", ") %>% mutate(total.price = price * quantity) %>% select(-...1, -gender) %>% select(-ends_with(".id")) %>% bind_cols(bike_joined_tbl %>% select(order.id)) %>% select(order.id, contains("order"), contains("model"), contains("category"), price, quantity, total.price, everything()) %>% set_names(names(.) %>% str_replace_all("\\.", "_")) sales_by_loc_tbl <- bike_orderlines_wrangled_tbl %>% select(state, total_price) %>% group_by(state) %>% summarize(sales = sum(total_price)) %>% mutate(sales_text = scales::dollar(sales, big.mark = ".", decimal.mark = ",", prefix = "", suffix = " €")) sales_by_loc_tbl ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #{r plot, fig.width=10, fig.height=7} # für markdown sales_by_loc_tbl %>% ggplot(aes(x = state, y = sales)) + geom_col(fill = "#2DC6D6") + geom_label(aes(label = sales_text)) + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format(big.mark = ".", decimal.mark = ",", prefix = "", suffix = " €")) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) + labs( title = "Sales by location", subtitle = "for states in Germany", x = "", y = "Revenue" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](01_tidyverse_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## SALES ANALYSIS Second Part ---- ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_238113bcd8b922d99143bcf5a98bc126'} ```{.r .cell-code} sales_by_loc_year_tbl <- bike_orderlines_wrangled_tbl %>% #select(order.date,total_price,state) %>% mutate(year=year(order_date)) %>% group_by(state, year) %>% summarize(sales = sum(total_price)) %>% ungroup() %>% mutate(sales_text = scales::dollar(sales, big.mark = ".", decimal.mark = ",", prefix = "", suffix = " €")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'state'. You can override using the #> `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} sales_by_loc_year_tbl ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} sales_by_loc_year_tbl %>% ggplot(aes(x = year, y = sales, fill = state)) + geom_col()+ facet_wrap(~state)+ scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format(big.mark = ".", decimal.mark = ",", prefix = "", suffix = " €")) + #theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) + labs( title = "Sales by location", subtitle = "for states in Germany", fill= "location" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](01_tidyverse_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #bike_orderlines_wrangled_tbl %>% #write_xlsx("content/01_bike_sales/bike_orderlines_wrangled.xlsx") ``` :::
